channel.title: IM runnin windows.................................Can I?
channel.description: im runnin Windows On my PC under all the users. Could I run linux then on my dads username. Or is that not possible, must the whole PC operate on just Windows.

item.title: IM runnin windows.................................Can I?
item.dc:creator: @kmb Kmb
item.description:
@kmb wrote:

Mr.Chris:

Am I right in thinking that the French Government now use Linux because of it’s absolute security?

According to this article, they now use Linux because
-“The deal is worth millions of Euros according to Mandrakesoft co-founder Gael Duval, who added that the ministry’s biggest savings will come from no longer paying Windows licensing fees.”
-“Microsoft announced last year that it would no longer support Windows NT beyond the end of this year.”.

Read full topic

item.title: IM runnin windows.................................Can I?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:13, topic:122480”]It all depends on personal preferences in my opinion. Sure, I don’t like the fact I’ve wasted $300 on Windows, or perhaps another $300 on games, but there’s pretty much an open source alternate for every windows program available for Linux, sure, it will need a change but unless your 100% happy with Windows and still use a common Windows product(except msn) regularly, there isn’t a need to switch.

I think it’s just a matter of weighing it all out. For example, there’s no linux alternates for my graphics card that work with my Bios, however, since I can use VMWare for gaming, I don’t need to install my graphics card driver. I also had to use ndiswrapper to get my wireless card to work, HOWEVER, that’s the only 2 drivers I needed to install. Ethernet, cd drive(including burning software), my laptops card reader, touch pad, sound and processor ALL works out of the box. With windows, I had to install everything from scratch, (on Kubuntu, all I had to do for firefox, java and flash is open the Add/Remove programs), however for windows, I needed to download everything and as I said, install it separate, however it’s so god damn easy to use. But it depends how you want to use your comp, it you want it extremely lightweight for normal web browsing and chatting, perhaps as a small Linux distro would be good. Same with extreme gaming(all good games have ports to linux(all id software I believe)), but if you just want a general OS, stick with windows.

However, since this is going slightly offtopic, I can split it into a small debate or we can just drop it.[/quote]

It’s fine. I guess wi-fi will just have to decide for himself, because there is no clear winner. Each has it’s own benefits, and that’s what’s behind capitalism. So choose Windows or Linux. Either way, you’re leading the fight against communism.

And for the record, I am no way a Windows geek, if it came across that way. I have Kubuntu and Windows on my PC, and I’m getting a MacBook eventually also.

Read full topic

item.title: IM runnin windows.................................Can I?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:12, topic:122480”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=172171.msg1592392#msg1592392 date=1184319627]
I’m not trying to make this in to one, however, it is STILL possible to get unwanted spyware under Windows unless your ridiculously careful and ONLY go to trusted sites, but if you want to look at it from the legal point of view, at any time when you download an illegal version of a program, you do risk getting into legal trouble.

But yes, I agree, if your experienced enough not to get viruses, there’s a small chance you will get one. I mean, I had one for a few months(only a small thing to log what websites I went to(strange, I know, definitly not a keylogger)).
[/quote]

Oh I understand, I was just saying I didn’t want this to develop into a massive war. And yea I understand Linux is much safer, but, given the learning curve, is it all that much better? Given the compatibility issues (I love Office 07 but I don’t want to deal with Wine) and other problems, why not just stick with XP?[/quote]

It all depends on personal preferences in my opinion. Sure, I don’t like the fact I’ve wasted $300 on Windows, or perhaps another $300 on games, but there’s pretty much an open source alternate for every windows program available for Linux, sure, it will need a change but unless your 100% happy with Windows and still use a common Windows product(except msn) regularly, there isn’t a need to switch.

I think it’s just a matter of weighing it all out. For example, there’s no linux alternates for my graphics card that work with my Bios, however, since I can use VMWare for gaming, I don’t need to install my graphics card driver. I also had to use ndiswrapper to get my wireless card to work, HOWEVER, that’s the only 2 drivers I needed to install. Ethernet, cd drive(including burning software), my laptops card reader, touch pad, sound and processor ALL works out of the box. With windows, I had to install everything from scratch, (on Kubuntu, all I had to do for firefox, java and flash is open the Add/Remove programs), however for windows, I needed to download everything and as I said, install it separate, however it’s so god damn easy to use. But it depends how you want to use your comp, it you want it extremely lightweight for normal web browsing and chatting, perhaps as a small Linux distro would be good. Same with extreme gaming(all good games have ports to linux(all id software I believe)), but if you just want a general OS, stick with windows.

However, since this is going slightly offtopic, I can split it into a small debate or we can just drop it.

Read full topic

item.title: IM runnin windows.................................Can I?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:11, topic:122480”]I’m not trying to make this in to one, however, it is STILL possible to get unwanted spyware under Windows unless your ridiculously careful and ONLY go to trusted sites, but if you want to look at it from the legal point of view, at any time when you download an illegal version of a program, you do risk getting into legal trouble.

But yes, I agree, if your experienced enough not to get viruses, there’s a small chance you will get one. I mean, I had one for a few months(only a small thing to log what websites I went to(strange, I know, definitly not a keylogger)).[/quote]

Oh I understand, I was just saying I didn’t want this to develop into a massive war. And yea I understand Linux is much safer, but, given the learning curve, is it all that much better? Given the compatibility issues (I love Office 07 but I don’t want to deal with Wine) and other problems, why not just stick with XP?

Read full topic

item.title: IM runnin windows.................................Can I?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:10, topic:122480”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=172171.msg1592305#msg1592305 date=1184317951]
Trust me, it’s worth it if you put effort in to it. Lets see, you will NEVER get viruses(VERY, VERY VERY VERY rarely out of stupidity), spyware, or shit like that. You’ll have one of the most secure pc’s in the world, you’ll be using completely free and open source software and will never have to pay for anything again.
[/quote]

I’d have to say the same for Windows. I really hate Win vs. Linux debates, but if you’re experienced enough to use Linux, you won’t have any trouble with viruses in the first place. Not to mention you don’t pay for anything either.[/quote]

I’m not trying to make this in to one, however, it is STILL possible to get unwanted spyware under Windows unless your ridiculously careful and ONLY go to trusted sites, but if you want to look at it from the legal point of view, at any time when you download an illegal version of a program, you do risk getting into legal trouble.

But yes, I agree, if your experienced enough not to get viruses, there’s a small chance you will get one. I mean, I had one for a few months(only a small thing to log what websites I went to(strange, I know, definitly not a keylogger)).

Read full topic

item.title: IM runnin windows.................................Can I?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

The Un-Named:

Trust me, it’s worth it if you put effort in to it. Lets see, you will NEVER get viruses(VERY, VERY VERY VERY rarely out of stupidity), spyware, or shit like that. You’ll have one of the most secure pc’s in the world, you’ll be using completely free and open source software and will never have to pay for anything again.

I’d have to say the same for Windows. I really hate Win vs. Linux debates, but if you’re experienced enough to use Linux, you won’t have any trouble with viruses in the first place. Not to mention you don’t pay for anything either.

Read full topic

item.title: IM runnin windows.................................Can I?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:8, topic:122480”][quote author=wi-fi23 link=topic=172171.msg1591393#msg1591393 date=1184294589]
'Is that one the best or wat about Xubuntu.
K thanks.
[/quote]

I really don’t have an opinion on this one. I’d stick with plain old Ubuntu, because you can actually switch between Ubuntu/Kubuntu/Xubuntu. I think Linux is overrated by the Linux community. Tbh, it’s not that worth it, unless you seriously have a problem with Windows.[/quote]

Trust me, it’s worth it if you put effort in to it. Lets see, you will NEVER get viruses(VERY, VERY VERY VERY rarely out of stupidity), spyware, or shit like that. You’ll have one of the most secure pc’s in the world, you’ll be using completely free and open source software and will never have to pay for anything again.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“wi-fi23, post:7, topic:122480”]'Is that one the best or wat about Xubuntu.
K thanks.[/quote]

I really don’t have an opinion on this one. I’d stick with plain old Ubuntu, because you can actually switch between Ubuntu/Kubuntu/Xubuntu. I think Linux is overrated by the Linux community. Tbh, it’s not that worth it, unless you seriously have a problem with Windows.
